definition: geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝妓|艺妓[yi4 ji4]

sentences.english: Many feel it will need all the wiles of the geisha to preserve its success.
sentences.chinese: 許多人感覺利用藝伎只不過是保存實力的詭計。

sentences.english: The simple and clean silhouette represents the adamancy and beauty of Geisha.
sentences.chinese: 以簡練的線條傳達藝伎的堅強與美麗。

sentences.english: You two went to geisha boot camp?
sentences.chinese: 你們兩個都參加了藝伎訓練，是吧？

sentences.english: Somewhere, under those rags…are you still the greatest geisha in Miyako?
sentences.chinese: 你在這深襤褸衣衫之下，仍是宮古市最美的藝伎嗎？

sentences.english: How hard was it to learn to be geisha?
sentences.chinese: 成爲一名藝伎有多難呢？

sentences.english: We also wanted people to learn more about maiko and geisha .
sentences.chinese: 我們也想讓更多人瞭解舞伎和藝伎。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝伎|艺伎[yi4 ji4]
the Shanghai of old, with its foreign settlements/(fig.) a bustling, cosmopolitan city
hard to distinguish real from imitation
